Prom Dated Received Political Resident in the Persian Gulf to Secretary of State for India. Risher, 14.15 hours, 30th March, 1939. 13.00 hours, 30th March, 1939. XXX IMPORTANT. 184. Addressed to Secretary of State for India, repeated to Political Agent, Bahrain, copy by post Government of India, Political Agent, Koweit. My immediately preceding telegram in which I repeated Bahrain telegram No.23 of March 28th. As Bahrain is en route to Egypt from Riyadh it may be difficult to refuse permission. 2. At Koweit I suggest that Japanese be given permission to land from mail steamer. 3. Do you concur? If so. Political Agent, Bahrain, will telegraph to Riyadh re Bahrain. Japanese can later be informed re Koweit.20 ' ^ Allotted to Political Departm ent. CoDles Circulated \269 1304. (67 groups) p ^ C Y P II K R Prom OP T K L ^ O R A M» Political Resident in the Persian Gulf to Secretary of State for India. Dated Received Risher, 14.15 hours, 30th March, 1939. 12.30 hours, 30th March, 1939. XMr'ORT.ANT . ' 183. Addressed to Secretary of State for India, repeated to Koweit, copy by post Government of India and Bahrein, Following telegram has been received from Political Agent, Bahrein. Begins . Minister at Jeddah telegraphs that Japanese Minister, Cairo, is visiting Riyadh about M a rch 31st to April 2nd. He then returns to Jeddah, but would like two ra of the staff to visit Bahrein and Koweit en route to iigypt. He requests that reply be sent to the Japanese Minister at Riyadh. 2. Japanese are definitely not wanted here. May I reply that the visit at such short notice would be inconvenient? Ends. RECo. POL. DEPt. 3 UiVlAh1939 INDIA OFFICE — —

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 2024/1939 'Desire of Japanese diplomatic staff to visit Bahrain and Kuwait'

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence relating to a proposed visit of Japanese diplomatic staff to Bahrain and Kuwait. The main correspondents are the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf and the India Office. The main recipients are the Political Agents in Kuwait and Bahrain and the Secretary of State for India.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
